1.description: Utterly alien beings that often have magical or otherworldly abilities.

2.description: Non-humanoid creatures that are naturally occuring parts of the fantasy ecology.

3.description: Creatures native to the upper planes. Often good in nature.

4.description: Unnatural beings that were made, not born. Some are programmed with simple instructions, but others are given sentience.

5.description: Large reptilian creatures of ancient origin and tremendous power.

6.description: Cretures native to the elemental planes.

7.description: Magical creatures closely tied to the forces of nature.

8.description: Creatures of wickedness that are often native to the lower planes.

9.description: Humanoid in shape but much, much larger.

10.description: Common denizens of a fantasy world. Includes the civilized and savage.

11.description: Monsters in the strictest sense. Frightening creatures that are neither ordinary nor natural.

12.description: Gelatinous creatures that rarely have a fixed shape.

13.description: Sentient plants outside of normal flora.

14.description: Once-living creatures brought to a state of undeath.
